course.title: Statistical Machine Learning
course.description: Hands-on introduction to network statistics, with applications to social, biological and communication networks. Topics in sampling designs and inference. Modeling network evolution. Processes on networks. Critical literature review, in class-presentations, and final projects.
course.prerequisites: Familiarity with estimation and inference techniques, and knowledge of a computer programming language (R or Matlab) required; Statistics 220 or 221 recommended.
course.notes: Computer programming exercises will apply the methods discussed in class.
